1) Pellet cells and resuspend in 1 mL of Trizol \(I have difficulty isolating quality RNA from less than 1 X 10<sup>6</sup> primary T cells).
1 mL of Trizol can be used for 1 X 10<sup>6</sup> to 10 X 10<sup>6</sup>.
It is best to brush the pelleted cells along a rack to dislodge them from the bottom of the tube.
Sometimes aggregates will still be visible.
Do not resuspend.
2) Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes
3) Add 200μL of Chloroform using a barrier pipette tip and shake each sample vigourously
4) Incubate at room temperature for 3 minutes
5) Centrifuge at 12000g for 15 minutes at 4°C
6) Transfer upper aqueous phase into a new RNAase free tube \(approximately 0.8-1 mL of volume)
7) Add 0.5 mL of isopropanol/mL of Trizol used and shake vigourously
8) Incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes
9) Centrifuge at 12000g for 15 minutes at 4°C
10) Pour off supernantant and wash pellet in with 1 mL of 75% ethanol \( do not resuspend pellet rather squirt in ethanol
so the pellet becomes dislodged from the bottom of tube)
Centrifuge at 12000g for 5 minutes at room temperature
12) Pour off supernantant and briefly dry pellet \(can use a 10μL pipette or a kimwipe corner to get rid of residual ethanol)
13) Dissolve pellet in 30μL of DepC treated water and place at 55°C for 5-10 minutes.
14) Spec and take 2μg for cDNA conversion.
Store the rest of the RNA at -80°C.
